channel.title: Camera Position Question
channel.description: Would there be any way to say, move the camera position once again? I remember a while back someone created a client that allowed for camera movement that worked with regular clients. I was thinking of an idea to move the camera position towards your characters head to allowed for a "first person" view of runescape. By "would there any way" I don't mean is it possible, I'm wondering if it is able to be accomplished with the current client. I don't mean a rearrangeable camera, I mean a set position (on your character's head.)

item.title: Camera Position Question
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“semaphore, post:8, topic:143998”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=197481.msg1762745#msg1762745 date=1190016058]
…and since today you can’t get an undetectable deob…
[/quote]

Why do you think that?[/quote]

Let me rephrase that…

Today you can’t get an undetectable deob by publicly available, pre-programmed means. In the past all you had to do was download waffendennis’s deob or double click my deob maker. Certainly it is possible to make an undetectable deob, it is simply not as easy as it used to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Camera Position Question
item.dc:creator: @Crack_Miners Crack Miners
item.description:
@Crack_Miners wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:7, topic:143998”][quote author=Crack Miners link=topic=197481.msg1763065#msg1763065 date=1190046775]

It is just as possible as it always was, I had this in MoparScape revolution for real runescape if anyone remembers that, back then I edited a deob to accomplish this, and since today you can’t get an undetectable deob you would have to edit the bytecode.

Your current private server client is open source correct? If so I can easily experiment with it until someone does develop a undetectable client in which I can implement later.
[/quote]a client is undetectable until you start doing stupid shit, like manually moving the camera where it shouldn’t go[/quote]

This is strictly for learning purposes, not instant gratification involving community reputation.

Read full topic

item.title: Camera Position Question
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

Moparisthebest:

…and since today you can’t get an undetectable deob…

Why do you think that?

It’s fairly trivial to run a deob without any more detectability than any other modified client. It requires a couple changes to the code where the reflection checks are made as well as a deob name mapping but other than that, there are really no other real obstacles to running a deob with no more detection than any other modified client.

I downplayed the term mapping. To explain, the mapping must be able to successfully return visibility modifiers on any field/method of the original codebase as well as original field/method names.
The simplest way that I can think of to accomplish this involves using zkm for renaming because it generates a flat-file change log. Parse the change log and you have a perfect mapping of the original -> deob names/visibilities.

Read full topic

Your current private server client is open source correct? If so I can easily experiment with it until someone does develop a undetectable client in which I can implement later.[/quote]a client is undetectable until you start doing stupid shit, like manually moving the camera where it shouldn’t go

item.title: Camera Position Question
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

There is no KNOWN way on how to do this, however, I’m sure it would be possible to do. Grab the latest deob, and start looking. If you find it, figure out a way to inject the code you use w/ BCEL. Remember, you only have around a week to find+inject+use until the client is updated and you have to start looking all over again. Unless of course you make an updater

Read full topic

item.title: Camera Position Question
item.dc:creator: @Crack_Miners Crack Miners
item.description:
@Crack_Miners wrote:

I don’t care about getting banned, if Jagex wants to ban people for making their experience playing the shit for game they’ve created that’s their problem. I’m wanting to know if the current client supports it.

Read full topic
